preview.title: DIY Layout Preview
preview.tooltip: Drag components below to this area for custom layout

componentPanel.title: Available Components
componentPanel.tooltip: Long press and drag components to the preview area
componentPanel.hint: üí° Tip: Long press a component for 0.3s to start dragging to preview area. Card turns yellow when long pressing. Placed components have a hide button below.

modelSelector.title: Model Selector Style
modelSelector.tooltip: Choose display style for model selector in DIY layout
modelSelector.hint: Icon mode is more compact, text mode shows current model clearly.

instructions.title: üé® DIY Layout Instructions
instructions.step1: First enable components in component display settings
instructions.step2: Long press components and drag them to preview area
instructions.step3: Place components anywhere on the toolbar
instructions.step4: Click the eye button below placed components to remove
instructions.step5: Click "Reset" to clear all custom positions
instructions.step6: Changes are saved and applied to chat page instantly

chatInterface.title: Chat Interface
chatInterface.description: Customize chat interface layout and display options

multiModel.title: Multi-Model Display
multiModel.description: Set layout for multi-model comparison. Horizontal shows responses side-by-side, vertical stacks them, single stacks them separately.

toolCall.description: Control whether to show detailed tool call information, including parameters and results.

systemPrompt.description: Control whether to show system prompt bubble at top of chat. It helps you view and edit the current session's system prompt.

background.title: Chat Background
background.description: Customize chat background image. Background only shows in message area, not affecting toolbar or sidebar. Messages appear above background.

errors.invalidFormat: Unsupported format. Please upload JPG, PNG, GIF or WebP.

instructions.minimal: ‚Ä¢ Minimal: Icon only, hover to view
instructions.stream: ‚Ä¢ Stream: Typewriter effect, word by word
instructions.dots: ‚Ä¢ Dots: Typing indicator like chat apps

preview.title: Live Preview
preview.description: View real-time thinking process display effect

texts.previewContent:
The user asked about "how to improve work efficiency". I need to analyze this question from multiple angles:

First, I should consider the definition of work efficiency. Work efficiency usually refers to the amount and quality of work completed per unit of time. Improving work efficiency can be approached from the following aspects:

1. Time Management
- Use the Pomodoro Technique, breaking work into 25-minute focused sessions
- Create a priority list, handling important and urgent tasks first
- Avoid multitasking, focus on one thing at a time

2. Work Environment Optimization
- Keep the workspace clean and organized
- Reduce distractions, such as closing unnecessary notifications
- Ensure good lighting and comfortable seating

3. Skill Development
- Learn to use efficiency tools and software
- Improve professional skills to reduce time needed to complete tasks
- Develop good communication skills

4. Physical and Mental Health
- Ensure adequate sleep
- Exercise regularly to maintain physical health
- Learn to relax and reduce stress

I think this answer covers the main aspects of work efficiency, being both practical and comprehensive. Users should be able to find methods that suit them.

versionSwitch.label: Version Switch Style
versionSwitch.popupDesc: ‚Ä¢ Popup: Click to show all versions list (default)
versionSwitch.arrowsDesc: ‚Ä¢ Arrows: Use left/right arrows to switch, like < 2 >

width.title: Bubble Width

width.description: Adjust bubble width range for different device screens

instructions.title: Width Settings:
instructions.aiMaxWidth: ‚Ä¢ AI Max Width: Controls max display width of AI replies
instructions.userMaxWidth: ‚Ä¢ User Max Width: Controls max display width of user messages
instructions.minWidth: ‚Ä¢ Min Width: Minimum width for all messages to avoid too narrow
instructions.note: ‚Ä¢ Smaller width fits phones, larger width fits tablets and desktops

searchSection.title: Search Prompts
searchSection.description: Quickly find the templates you need in our rich prompt library

enable.label: Enable Web Search
enable.tooltip: When enabled, AI can get the latest information through web search

debug.currentProvider: Debug Info: Current provider ({{provider}}) API key: {{status}}

tavily.text: Tavily is a search API designed for AI, providing high-quality search results. Now using a mobile-compatible SDK that completely avoids CORS limitations. Visit

exa.text: Exa is a neural network-based search engine that provides semantic search. Visit

bocha.text: Bocha is an AI-powered search engine that provides intelligent search results. Visit

bingFree.text: Free search service, no API key required. You can choose different search engines to get search results, including Bing, Google, Baidu, Sogou, etc. Uses capacitor-cors-bypass-enhanced plugin to solve mobile CORS issues.

firecrawl.text: Firecrawl provides powerful web scraping and search capabilities. Visit

searchMode.manual: Manual Search (Click search button to start)

tavily.title: üöÄ Tavily Best Practices Settings

minScore.description: Filter out search results with relevance scores below this threshold

newsSearchDays.description: Used when search topic is set to "News"

includeRawContent.label: Include Raw Content
includeRawContent.tooltip: Get complete webpage content for deep analysis

systemPromptVariables.title: System Prompt Variable Injection
systemPromptVariables.description: Automatically inject dynamic variables like time and location into system prompts
systemPromptVariables.infoMessage: When enabled, the system will automatically append corresponding variable information to the end of the system prompt when sending messages.

timeVariable.hint: Time information will be automatically appended to the end of the system prompt

locationVariable.placeholder: Enter custom location (e.g., Beijing, Chaoyang District)
locationVariable.hint: Location information will be automatically appended to the end of the system prompt
locationVariable.hintEmpty: Leave empty to use system-detected location

osVariable.label: Operating System Variable
osVariable.hint: OS information will be automatically appended to the end of the system prompt
